timeline.message: Add in basic autolabeler github action
Add in missing quotes from yaml - we should definitely consider the yaml linter
Give credit to spark project for the top level doc comment
Sentence syntax for the comment crediting spark project

timeline.bodyText: Do I need to add the ASF iceberg license at the top of the file manually or will that happen on merge or in some other way?
timeline.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText: Yes,  I think we should attach the license header in this file manually.
replies.author: openinx

replies.bodyText: Yes, we need the ASF header.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
Header has been added.
I wasn't sure if there was a process to automatically add it to new files. If the ASF infra team maintains a github api token which is accessible (as a secret that they rotate out or something), then it would be possible to have the license added to the top of all new files automatically.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.bodyText: This project doesn't use maven. Should we remove this? And what about the files that are also in .gitignore?
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"

replies.bodyText:
Woops this was left over from the version I was using in the spark project. I'll remove the maven references etc.
As for the fils in the .gitignore, I can remove those too if we'd like.
replies.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText:
Unless I'm mistaken, any file in the .gitignore shouldn't be able to make its way into a PR, so that should not be a problem (unless I'm not understanding the question correctly).
The .gitignore file itself however is labeled as infra. Let me know if this does not cover your concern.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.bodyText: These two look like they can be removed as well.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"

replies.bodyText: These have been removed. Thanks for catching them. I used the spark project's autolabeler as a template and accidentally left those in there in my rush to get some eyeballs on these, as I didn't feel particularly qualified to make a decision on how things should be labeled - just willing to add the autolabeling.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.bodyText: The only scripts are in dev, so I think we can remove this tag.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"
+  - "gradle/"
+  - "**.gradle"
+BASH:
+  - "dev/check-license"
+  - "**.sh"

replies.bodyText:
I've removed this in favor of just dev/. Since PRs can have mutliple labels, I personally still feel that having a check on **.sh, which would match any file ending in .sh, would be good for future proofing but I will leave the call to your discretion. You've spent far more time than myself looking at PRs and mentally categorizing them.
Additionally, I'll be around to help keep this up to date as time goes on.  😄
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.bodyText: I think that LICENSE and NOTICE changes should be tagged "license" instead.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"
+  - "gradle/"
+  - "**.gradle"
+BASH:
+  - "dev/check-license"
+  - "**.sh"
+DOCS:
+  - "site/"
+  - "!/site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "**CHANGELOG.md"
+  - "**LICENSE"
+  - "**NOTICE"

replies.bodyText:
Good call. I struggle with where to put these myself. I've made a LICENSE tag that will match any files (or directories technically) named LICENSE or NOTICE.
LICENSE:
  - "**LICENSE"
  - "**NOTICE"
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"
+  - "gradle/"
+  - "**.gradle"
+BASH:
+  - "dev/check-license"
+  - "**.sh"
+DOCS:
+  - "site/"
+  - "!/site/mkdocs.yml"

replies.bodyText: Yes this excludes that. I believe I put it under INFRASTRUCTURE instead. However, I'm fully open to whatever you prefer as I'm very new to the project and don't spend a fraction of the amount of time looking at PRs that you do.
replies.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText: Let's put it in docs, since it controls docs layout.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Good call. The spark project, where I took my inspiration, has much more granular additions and usages of excludes. I prefer your approach to a simpler layout based on what things affect. 👍
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.bodyText: How about separating Python out into its own tag? I don't think that combining it with the others will be helpful for people looking to find PRs.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"
+  - "gradle/"
+  - "**.gradle"
+BASH:
+  - "dev/check-license"
+  - "**.sh"
+DOCS:
+  - "site/"
+  - "!/site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "**CHANGELOG.md"
+  - "**LICENSE"
+  - "**NOTICE"
+  - "**README.md"
+EXAMPLES:
+  - "examples/"
+COMMON:
+  - "common/"
+API:
+  - "api/"
+  - "python/iceberg/api/"
+  - "python/tests/api/"

replies.bodyText: There is currently a python tag. This would tag them as python and api. I can remove them in favor of keeping it simple and using just python if preferred.
replies.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText: Yeah, let's keep it simple for now. Thanks!
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Oh and my mistake. I had originally had a python label and somehow I dropped it in the mix. I agree, simpler is better for now.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"
+  - "gradle/"
+  - "**.gradle"
+BASH:
+  - "dev/check-license"
+  - "**.sh"
+DOCS:
+  - "site/"
+  - "!/site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "**CHANGELOG.md"
+  - "**LICENSE"
+  - "**NOTICE"
+  - "**README.md"
+EXAMPLES:
+  - "examples/"
+COMMON:
+  - "common/"
+API:
+  - "api/"
+  - "python/iceberg/api/"
+  - "python/tests/api/"
+CORE:
+  - "**/core/"

replies.bodyText: This matches all files underneath a directory called core, that might be nested underneath 0 or more directories. I can remove them if we think that complicates things.
replies.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText: I don't think we want to match subdirectories, just the top-level ones.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
Ok. That sounds good to me. I was thinking in the case where python might get expanded out more in the future, but I am now leaning more towards your simpler is better approach.
I'll remove all of the matches for subdirectories.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.bodyText: What about having a single Spark tag instead of 2? I think most of the time we will want to make sure that we are updating both versions.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/"
+  - ".github/"
+  - "/dev/"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev/"
+  - "/project/"
+  - "/assembly/"
+  - "*pom.xml"
+  - "/bin/docker-image-tool.sh"
+  - "/bin/find-spark-home*"
+  - "gradle/"
+  - "**.gradle"
+BASH:
+  - "dev/check-license"
+  - "**.sh"
+DOCS:
+  - "site/"
+  - "!/site/mkdocs.yml"
+  - "**CHANGELOG.md"
+  - "**LICENSE"
+  - "**NOTICE"
+  - "**README.md"
+EXAMPLES:
+  - "examples/"
+COMMON:
+  - "common/"
+API:
+  - "api/"
+  - "python/iceberg/api/"
+  - "python/tests/api/"
+CORE:
+  - "**/core/"
+  - "core/"
+  - "python/iceberg/core/"
+  - "python/tests/core/"
+PARQUET:
+  - "**/parquet/"
+  - "parquet/"
+ARROW:
+  - "**/arrow/"
+  - "arrow/"
+ORC:
+  - "**/orc/"
+  - "orc/"
+HIVE:
+  - "**/hive/"
+  - "hive/"
+DATA:
+  - "**/data/"
+  - "data/"
+SPARK2:

replies.bodyText: I think that's a good idea. I originally chose to follow just the modules as listed, but anybody interested in SPARK is likely interested in all of the spark related code.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.message: add the asf license file header
address some more PR feedback on keeping mkdocs.yaml in docs and out of infrastructure
Only match on top level directories, not subdirectories
label any file with gradle in the name as BUILD and include the gradle version dependencies properties file
theres no need for the top level gradle folder rule as it will be matched by the all files or directories containing gradle rule
Make the license comment a valid YAML comment and then use a leading slash to match files and directories below top level folders
Leave an empty line between the license header and file contents

timeline.bodyText: I thought dev was going to be part of "infra", so we can remove "bash" altogether.
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+#
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+#
+
+# The following paragraph was taken from the Apache Spark project.
+#   see: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/.github/autolabeler.yml
+#
+# Bot page: https://github.com/apps/probot-autolabeler
+# The matching patterns follow the .gitignore spec.
+# See: https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore#_pattern_format
+# Also, note that the plugin uses 'ignore' package. See also
+# https://github.com/kaelzhang/node-ignore
+INFRA:
+  - ".baseline/**"
+  - ".github/**"
+  - ".asf.yaml"
+  - ".gitattributes"
+  - ".gitignore"
+  - "baseline.gradle"
+  - "deploy.gradle"
+  - "jitpack.yml"
+  - "travis.yml"
+BUILD:
+  - "/dev"
+  - "**gradle**"
+  - "versions.props"
+BASH:
+  - "/dev"

replies.bodyText: Yeah definitely.
replies.author: kbendick

replies.bodyText: The bash label has been removed and everything underneath /dev will be labeled as infra.
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.message: Merge branch 'autolabeler-github-action' of github.com:kbendick/iceberg into autolabeler-github-action
move dev directory from build to infra
use leading slash notation for top level folders starting with a . now that its tested in my own fork
